Package org.jgroups.opentelemetry.impl.util

Class RegistrationHelper

java.lang.Object
org.jgroups.opentelemetry.impl.util.RegistrationHelper
public final class RegistrationHelper extends Object
Helper class for metric registration operations. Provides methods for registering metrics with OpenTelemetry.
Author:
Radoslav Husar

  • Method Details

    • registerLongGauge

      public void registerLongGauge(String nameComponent, String description, ObservableUnit unit, Consumer<io.opentelemetry.api.metrics.ObservableLongMeasurement> callback)
      Registers a long gauge metric with the OpenTelemetry meter. This is a convenience method that wraps the common pattern of creating a gauge builder, configuring it, and building it with a callback. The full metric name is constructed by prepending the protocol prefix from the context. The callback is automatically wrapped to attach context attributes (e.g., cluster name) to measurements.
      Parameters:
      nameComponent - The metric name component (e.g., "messages.sent"), will be prefixed with the protocol prefix
      description - A human-readable description of the metric
      unit - The unit of measurement from ObservableUnit
      callback - The callback that records the metric value

    • registerDoubleGauge

      public void registerDoubleGauge(String nameComponent, String description, ObservableUnit unit, Consumer<io.opentelemetry.api.metrics.ObservableDoubleMeasurement> callback)
      Registers a double gauge metric with the OpenTelemetry meter. This is a convenience method that wraps the common pattern of creating a gauge builder, configuring it, and building it with a callback. The full metric name is constructed by prepending the protocol prefix from the context. The callback is automatically wrapped to attach context attributes (e.g., cluster name) to measurements.
      Parameters:
      nameComponent - The metric name component (e.g., "avg_queue_size"), will be prefixed with the protocol prefix
      description - A human-readable description of the metric
      unit - The unit of measurement from ObservableUnit
      callback - The callback that records the metric value

    • registerLongCounter

      public void registerLongCounter(String nameComponent, String description, ObservableUnit unit, Consumer<io.opentelemetry.api.metrics.ObservableLongMeasurement> callback)
      Registers an asynchronous long counter metric with the OpenTelemetry meter. Counters are monotonically increasing values (never decrease). The full metric name is constructed by prepending the protocol prefix from the context. The callback is automatically wrapped to attach context attributes (e.g., cluster name) to measurements.
      Parameters:
      nameComponent - The metric name component (e.g., "messages.sent"), will be prefixed with the protocol prefix
      description - A human-readable description of the metric
      unit - The unit of measurement from ObservableUnit
      callback - The callback that records the metric value

    • registerLongUpDownCounter

      public void registerLongUpDownCounter(String nameComponent, String description, ObservableUnit unit, Consumer<io.opentelemetry.api.metrics.ObservableLongMeasurement> callback)
      Registers an asynchronous long up-down counter metric with the OpenTelemetry meter. Up-down counters can increase or decrease (e.g., number of active connections). The full metric name is constructed by prepending the protocol prefix from the context. The callback is automatically wrapped to attach context attributes (e.g., cluster name) to measurements.
      Parameters:
      nameComponent - The metric name component (e.g., "connections.active"), will be prefixed with the protocol prefix
      description - A human-readable description of the metric
      unit - The unit of measurement from ObservableUnit
      callback - The callback that records the metric value

    • registerLongHistogram

      public io.opentelemetry.api.metrics.LongHistogram registerLongHistogram(String nameComponent, String description, ObservableUnit unit)
      Registers a synchronous long histogram metric with the OpenTelemetry meter. Histograms record distributions of values (e.g., latency measurements). The full metric name is constructed by prepending the protocol prefix from the context.
      Parameters:
      nameComponent - The metric name component (e.g., "latency"), will be prefixed with the protocol prefix
      description - A human-readable description of the metric
      unit - The unit of measurement from ObservableUnit
      Returns:
      The LongHistogram instrument that can be used to record values
